about_the_game:
Judge the Fate of the Dead in this satirical, bureaucratic, decision-making game. Talk to Souls, check their documents, reference Holy Texts and decide if they're going Up or Down. Follow the Rules or trust your own moral compass and see where your choices take you - hopefully not the Elevator Down.


Read different documents, from Life Summaries to Holy Texts, and decide each Soul's Fate. Test your ability to follow complex guidelines, as you decide who goes Up and who Down!



Balance strict Rules from various Religions, while also adhering to your own sense of Justice. Each Soul has you face ethical dilemmas, making every decision hinge on your morality!



Meet a variety of Souls from modern fantasy worlds, like elves, tieflings, and mermaids. Interact with Angels, Demons, and the Grim Reaper, and build relationships with these recurring NPCs, that might even turn romantic!



Experience a branching narrative where your choices determine the fate of not only the Souls you Judge but also your own, and that of the entire universe. Discover the answers to many questions about Religion, Morality and the Universe in over 20 possible endings!

content_descriptors.notes:
The game deals with life and death and therefore often mentions sensitive themes. 

While there is no scene in the game explicitly showing any kind of violence, death, substance abuse, or sexual content all of these subjects are referenced in details about people's lives and in the narrative.

Follow the Rules or trust your own moral compass and see where your choices take you - hopefully not the Elevator Down.


Read different documents, from Life Summaries to Holy Texts, and decide each Soul's Fate. Test your ability to follow complex guidelines, as you decide who goes Up and who Down!

Meet a variety of Souls from modern fantasy worlds, like elves, tieflings, and mermaids. Interact with Angels, Demons, and the Grim Reaper, and build relationships with these recurring NPCs, that might even turn romantic!



Experience a branching narrative where your choices determine the fate of not only the Souls you Judge but also your own, and that of the entire universe. Discover the answers to many questions about Religion, Morality and the Universe in over 20 possible endings!

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: 64-bit OS
  • Processor: X64 architecture with SSE2 instruction set support (Intel Core i3 or better)
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Vulkan
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: 64-bit OS
  • Processor: X64 architecture with SSE2 instruction set support (Intel Core i5 or better)
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Vulkan
  • Storage: 2 GB available space

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: MacOS version 10.13 or newer
  • Processor: X64 architecture with SSE2 instruction set support (Intel Core i3 or better)
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Metal-capable Intel and AMD GPUs
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
mac_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: MacOS version 10.13 or newer
  • Processor: X64 architecture with SSE2 instruction set support (Intel Core i5 or better)
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Metal-capable Intel and AMD GPUs
  • Storage: 2 GB available space

name: Elevator Down

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Windows 7
  • Processor: X64 architecture with SSE2 instruction set support (Intel Core i3 or better)
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Integraded Graphics
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: X64 architecture with SSE2 instruction set support (Intel Core i5 or better)
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Integraded Graphics
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
